home.title: Terra Mystica Solo Helper
home.play1: Play the Automa Solo Mode of Terra Mystica. The expansions Fire & Ice and Merchants of the Seas are supported.
home.play2: To play the solo mode you need the base game and the Automa Solo Box. This helper application replaces the Automa cards.

players.title: Player
players.twoPlayerBotFaction: When playing with two players, the official rules only allow to play with The Simpletons.

setupGameAutoma.title: Automa Setup
setupGameAutoma.generalSetupIntro: Set up the game as normal with the following changes:
setupGameAutoma.step1: Use the double-sided Automa Scoring tiles instead of those from the game. Place the side face-up that shows the relevant round. As in the base game, the Scoring tile with the Spade on its left side cannot be placed in Round 5 or 6.
setupGameAutoma.step1-mots: Use the double-sided Merchants of the Seas Automa Scoring tiles, instead.
setupGameAutoma.step2: Place the new Game end token as usual but only cover the top right quarter of the Round 6 Scoring tile.
setupGameAutoma.step3: Choose a Home Terrain type (color) that is different from yours and give Automa the matching Automa Terrain priority (ATP) card. The ATP’s Terrain type is indicated by the top and bottom bars and the leftmost circles.
setupGameAutoma.step4: For Automa skip the normal faction setup procedure and instead:
setupGameAutoma.step4a: Give her all Structures of her color.
setupGameAutoma.step4b: Return 2 Automa Dwellings to the box. They will not be used.
setupGameAutoma.step4c-mots: Return 2 Automa Trading houses to the box. They will not be used.
setupGameAutoma.step4d: Give her all Priests of her color.
setupGameAutoma.step4e: Place her Markers on the Cult track. Advance on these tracks:
setupGameAutoma.step4f: Follow the additional setup instructions on the {faction} Automa Faction card and familiarize yourself with the special rules.
setupGameAutoma.step4g: Place a Marker of Automa’s color on space 20 of the Victory point track (as normal).
setupGameAutoma.step4h-mots: Give her all Trade markers and the Shipyard in her color.
setupGameAutoma.step5: Shuffle the {count} Bonus cards and place them face-up in a horizontal line. Give Automa the first one. Choose your own Bonus card.
setupGameAutoma.initialDwellingIntro: Automa places her initial Dwellings after you place your first Dwelling. Select the Automa Initial Dwelling map card for the map you are using and refer to it as you:
setupGameAutoma.initialDwellingMarked: Place an Automa Dwelling on a Home Terrain space with letter {character}, together with a power token.
setupGameAutoma.initialDwellingUnmarked: Place an Automa Dwelling on a Home Terrain space with letter {character}.

income.title: Income
income.collect: Collect new Workers, Coins, Priests ans Power.

playerTurn.text: Please make your turn - or pass.
playerTurn.passInfo: Collect your round bonus victory points (if any) and take a new Bonus card.

gainVictoryPoints.text: Automa gains {count} victory point. | Automa gains {count} victory points.

validSpaces.marked: Withing Range of any marked Structure
validSpaces.marked-reaching: Withing Range of any marked Structure (with Reaching)
validSpaces.unmarked: Withing Range of any unmarked Structure
validSpaces.unmarked-reaching: Withing Range of any unmarked Structure (with Reaching)

tiebreaker.title: Select Space:
tiebreaker.terrainPriorityYourTerrainType: Terrain Priority with ATP card of your terrain type.
tiebreaker.structureClosest: Space closest to any of your Structures.
tiebreaker.structureFurthest: Space furthest away from any of your Structures.

execute.title: Execute:
execute.homeTerrainTile: Place an Automa Home Terrain tile (if transforming was required).
execute.marked: Mark the new Dwelling by placing a Power token on its space.

reaching.title: Reaching
reaching.text1: If none of the marked Structures are adjacent (directly or indirectly) to any of the unmarked Structures the valid spaces are further limited to only those that would decrease the current shortest distance between marked and unmarked structures.
reaching.text2: If there are none that would decrease it, all the spaces previously identified remain valid.

tiebreaker.title: Choose structure:
tiebreaker.tradingHouse: If Automa has a Trading house available: Automa Dwellings adjacent to any of your Structures. Otherwise, any Structure that Automa can upgrade.
tiebreaker.littlePower: Giving you as little Power as possible.

execute.title: Execute:
execute.highestPowerStructure: Replace the chosen Structure with the highest Power value Structure it can be legally upgraded to.
execute.motsShipyardPreferred: If there’s a tie between Stronghold and Shipyard Automa builds her Shipyard.

blockPowerAction.gameBoard: Block one uncovered power action on game board
blockPowerAction.gameBoardExecute: Execute: Place an Action token on the selected Power action. Automa gains no benefit from this.
blockPowerAction.motsPowerActionBoard: Block one uncovered power action on Merchant Power Actions Board.

advanceCultTrack.factionDruids: Automa advances 2 spaces on a single track (without placing a Priest).
advanceCultTrack.factionPowerMongers: Ongoing Benefit: Whenever you gain 2 or more Power via structures, Automa advances 1 space on a Cult track (Cult Catch-up action without placing a Priest).
advanceCultTrack.notMarker10: Automa advances only on tracks without a Marker on space 10.

scoringTile.title: Prefer cult track matching the color of the Automa icon on current Scoring tile.

catchUp.title: Use Catch-Up selection:
catchUp.marketAt0: The Cult track where Automa‘s Marker is at 0.
catchUp.highestMarker: The Cult track where Automa‘s Marker is nearest to your Marker; it can be on the same space or above or below you.
catchUp.highestMarkerMultipleHumans: The Cult track, where Automa‘s Marker is nearest to the highest Marker; it can be on the same space or above or below the other marker.

execute.title: Execute:
execute.placePriest: Place an available Automa Priest on the highest numbered Priest space below the chosen track and advance Automa‘s Marker the corresponding number of spaces.
execute.noPriest: If Automa has no more available Priests, or if there’s no empty Priest space available below the track, advance Automa‘s Marker by 1 on that track without placing a Priest.

selectStructure.title: Select structure adjacent to a river space without one of Automa's Trade tokens:
selectStructure.highestPower: Structures with the highest Power value.

execute.title: Execute:
execute.placeMarker: Place one of Automa’s Trade markers beneath the selected Structure.
execute.victoryPoints: Automa gains Victory points equal to the Power value of the selected Structure.
execute.gainPower: You may gain Power for the trade, as normal.

takeFavorTile.selectCultFavorTile: Take one of the +3 Cult Favor tiles for Cult tracks without a Marker on space 10.
takeFavorTile.execute: Execute: Give the chosen tile to Automa and increase her Marker by 3 on the track shown on the tile.

factionSymbiontsPlaceCube.validSpaces: Valid Spaces: All Terrain spaces directly adjacent to any of your structures.
factionSymbiontsPlaceCube.placeCube: Place a worker cube on the selected Terrain space.

botPass.title: Automa passes.
botPass.scoringTile: Automa gains a fixed number of Victory points as shown in the lower right corner of the current Scoring tile.
botPass.scoringTileFactionRacelings: Racelings: Automa passed first this round and gains the fixed number of Victory Points on the current Scoring tile again.
botPass.bonusCardGold: If there are any coins on the Bonus card return them to the general supply.

endOfRound.title: End of Round
endOfRound.bonusCardsCoin: Put 1 Coin on each of the three leftover Bonus Cards.
endOfRound.removeScoringTile: Remove current scoring tile from board.

endOfGame.title: End of Game
endOfGame.cultScoring: Automa gains victory points from Cult scoring.
endOfGame.areaScoring: Automa gains victory points from Area scoring.
endOfGame.areaScoringFireIceStrongholdSanctuary: Stronghold and Sanctuary: Divide Greatest Distance by 2 and round up.
endOfGame.factionWanderers: Wanderers: Gain 1 victory point per structure anywhere on the board.
endOfGame.factionGognomes: Gognomes: Ensure Gognomes got victory points for their achievements.
endOfGame.resourceScoring: Automa doesn't get any points from Resource scoring.

action.abortGameConfirm: Aborting the running game - are you sure?
action.endGameConfirm: End this game and return to home screen - are you sure?
